title: Rruchi man
author: Rruchi man
content: I found this interesting read that there are  psychological tricks offline casino's use to make visitors spend more money, I have summarized the article and added the link at the end for anyone who wants to read more, Why? cos like I mentioned, it is an interesting read!So some of these tricks are;1. Enticing Design - You know casinos spend a whole lot to ensure that their interiors are exquisite and speak luxury, you always want to come back.2. Lack of Clocks and Natural Light - No clock means you won't be able to know when it's time to go, the more time you spend, the money you spend.3. Cashless Games - You buy credit for slots or chips, so you also may not be able to keep track of your money.others according to the article are: Stimulating Lights and Sounds, Memorable Scents, Near-Misses, Familiar Concepts, a Sense of Control.SEE ARTICLE HERENow I understand that Online casinos are not left out and also apply some psychological tricks on us. The aim of these topic is not to say that it is bad as all businesses have their methods to increase profits, but for us to collectively highlight some psychology that online casinos can use. I have identified some as they are similar to those the articles highlighted as it seemed to be mostly focused on offline casinos, they are;1. Good and user friendly design.2. Cashless games is definitely among.3. Stimulating sounds seem to be one. (Please add to the list)

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Casinos need to earn profits, but it is not necessary to use any methods that harm players. There are several ways to approach this issue, and online casinos can follow the steps made by offline casinos. They can try some of the techniques mentioned above to attract more people, while not harming them as suggested in the article. The major key in all of the above is user experience. Here are some more common techniques that you'll often find in online casinos:- They allow people to socialize and interact with other players, thus making the gaming experience more exciting- They offer a number of bonuses and rewards to players- They make sure that the games they offer are engaging and entertaining, so players won’t get bored after playing a few rounds- They allow players to bet with different types of currencies- They have customer support teams that are available 24/7, so players can get help whenever they need itAt the end of the day, it's all about making sure you keep your players happy. The better they feel while playing at your casino, the more likely they are to keep coming back.

comments.body: These 3 things that you've mentioned are really common psychological tricks that casinos do. However, I think that the first one which is "Enticing Design" isn't really about a psychological trick at all since all businesses/establishment are somehow has a great interior design however Casinos are more of on the luxurious side as their target are huge paying customers or gamblers. I think one of psychological tricks that should be also added are bonuses and membership. As these things usually attracts more gamblers to come back and continue gambling for a long time due to the bonuses and rewards that they could get on their membership at a casino.

comments.author: acroman08
comments.body: I remember reading long ago that they also use our subconscious minds to their advantage. you might think that they place their games in certain places just for aesthetics or something, but no, their games are strategically placed to lure you into their casino without you actually realizing it. this might be a little off-topic but the funny thing is casinos are not the only one using our subconscious to their advantage, grocery store, supermarket, etc.. uses the same tactic in order to make you stay longer, and spend more money on their store.

comments.author: serjent05
comments.body: I think there is no greater psychological tricks that casinos can use other than the enticement of huge wins. Greed is among the human nature.  Often times greed takes over when an opportunity present itself.  With the offer of huge winnings, people will flock in to that place.  One great example is the lottery.  It doesn't have any amazing sounds  but people keep on coming and the reason is to have a chance in winning the huge jackpot price.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: I would also add the fact that some casinos also offer perks to their gamblers depending on how much money they put on the table. Casual gamblers can get some appetizers or a free drink, while high-rollers can get VIP access to casino/ hotel rooms, for example.Either way, those are methods to make people comfortable in the casino and increase the chances they come back in the future.One of my cousins had some preference for a casino (which was within a hotel) because they offered him free beer as he gambled.

comments.author: Welsh
comments.body: Not that I'll ever experience this, but if you're gambling a rather large amount, they'll target you for free drinks, and sometimes free accommodation depending on your spending habits. Of course, it's not really free, since they're trying to keep you in the casino a lot longer, and have been monitoring you via CCTV or by just watching you. I think this is a commonly known thing though, so nothing out of the ordinary. I'm not a particular fan of this method though. Any method really, honestly. Seems unethical to me.

comments.author: dothebeats
comments.body: Number 2 is true. Since there aren't any windows nor clocks around the casino premises, you'll not be able to tell time unless you really look into your phone or your watch. It's a trick that lures you into playing more and more since you're not aware of the time. Also, if you ask the casino staff around (tried this lots of times), they'd indirectly answer you or tell you some words to describe what time it is and not actually tell the exact time to you.
